title: "We don't like ball of stats" - Riot Games
body:
{{champion:157}} We're gonna make it so that he can statistically crit twice as often as anyone else with the ***SAME EXACT BUILD***, but it's ok, cause his crits are only going to do 90%, and not 100% extra damage. Until he gets an IE that is! Best part is, building ASPD lowers the CD of your auto reset which can also critically strike. We did this since we know how much you guys love auto attacking. Now you can auto while you auto, so that you can crit while your critting! Oh, I also forgot to tell you that you can say goodbye to half of that pesky bonus armor your enemies are getting from masteries, runes, and items after you ult! Now those big ol' nasty tanks (top kek, when the last time you seen a tank?) won't be able to rain on your parade

{{champion:150}}  We're gonna give this adorable little guy a shit ton of free stats and CC upon transformation, but it's ok, cause he can't control it, and while in mini form he has just about the same as everyone else, but gets to kite melees as hard as Olaf permaslowing someone he is chasing, while doing % max health magic damage. Hope you guys built MR against this fur ball that is building AD.

{{champion:421}} We're gonna give her Physical, Magic, AND true damage. But it's ok, she can only hit you with true damage at full fury, but to seperate the good from the greats, we are gonna also give her AoE on her autos for 5 seconds after pressing Q, while the CD on it is only 4. This way the good Rek'Sai use that extra fury to heal themselves, while the greats nuke you with True Damage! Did I forget to mention the 40% free ASPD she gets at level 6? This way generating fury without building CDR to skill spam, or ASPD to auto quickly won't matter!

{{champion:69}} Aight so boom. Due to how unsatisfying it was for you guys to use her, we give her a shit ton of free stats in her passive. Now you get free CDR, and a shit ton of free AP. Now you don't have to waste money buying CDR, and you can easily hit over 1k AP! We also made it so that she gets to drain tank and win all of her fights if you bought WotA cause now you can drain tank almost like an ADC! Don't forget that your DoTs become even more powerful by up to 40% just by hitting someone with E twice! This'll separate the good Cass's from the greats. Also for all you non math savvy types out there, DCap passive, masteries, and Cass's innate multiplicatively stack, and boost your AP by a whopping 77.45%! This is Phreak approved as you'll be doing tons of damage!

Master Yi gets 10% of his total AD passively, and can deal an additional 20% of his total AD in True Damage, *and* has an extendable 10-second AS steroid. Zed gets 25% of his bonus AD in bonus AD.

You're going to have to do much better than simply saying, "He has this one steroid that does something different from other melees' steroids!"

And you *do not understand the mechanic,* so sit down and listen up.

Yasuo's passive doubles his Crit Chance; in exchange, the *total* damage of his Crits are reduced by 10%. In cases of his Q critting, it's 25%.

This is a *total damage reduction,* not just Crit Damage. A normal Crit by anyone else deals 200% damage. Yasuo's passive makes it 200 x 0.9 = 180% damage. In the case of his Q, it's 200 x 0.75 = 150% damage. When he has Infinity Edge, it's 250 x 0.9 = 225%; with his Q, 250 x 0.75 = 187.5% damage.

It's definitely a more powerful damage reduction than you think. I've done the math before, and a Tryndamere with a 3-item build matching Yasuo (the person had theorized Infinity Edge, Statikk Shiv and Ravenous Hydra) is capable of the same DPS, if not greater, as Yasuo. Never mind that, in a duel, Tryndamere would immediately have the advantage of his 80 AD reduction, but that's another matter entirely.

Basically put, the three other commonly-referred-to-as Melee Carries--Master Yi, Tryndamere and Fiora--are all capable of out-scaling Yasuo's DPS in the late-game. Yasuo is the one that has the strongest mid-game among them.

Ok, but how does this make him not a ball of stats though?

Because it's *one* steroid, and it's the only steroid in the game that requires items to actually have any effect.

Look at every other stat steroid in the game. Sure, all of them *synergize* with stats or specific items, but do any steroids other than Yasuo's actually have literally no effect until you've built items?

*Yes, I know, there are Crit runes, and it's normal to use them on Yasuo, but you're still buying those stats in order for his steroid to work in the first place.*

Because if Yasuo decides to dash through the wrong thing, or gets his placement wrong, OR if he misses his Q, which plenty of people still do considering it's pretty easy to make him miss, he's not going to be "ball of stat" fighting anything.

There IS a method to his gameplay, you just don't know how to deal with him.
Get a little hard CC, use a ranged AA champion, sure he has his wind wall, but the cooldown on it is ridiculous, and if he drops his wall down, you should know not to try to pick at him, and just back up, or walk through it instead.

{{champion:133}} Quinn is particularly good versus Yasuo.

The point is, balls of stats are champions that walk in, press all the buttons, and walk out, Yasuo can't do that against a competent player, or he'll lose a lot of the time.

He isn't twice as gold efficient for any main item.  He is twice as gold efficient for the crit component of the items he buys, not all the stats.
Also, he penetrates 50% of bonus armor. His ult doesn't help against anything but bonus armor. So it wouldn't deny tanks all their armor, just half of the extra.

Look at this then{{item:3143}} (70 armor & 500 health for 2850 gold), {{item:3068}} ( 45 armor & 450 health for 2600 gold) and {{item:3110}} ( 100 armor, 400 mana, & 20% cdr for 2450) 

All together that is 215 bonus and 950 health for 7900 gold. Due to his ult, the tank only receives 107.5 bonus armor against Yas. This isn't even counting {{item:3035}} or any health% items that make the protections more useless (both of which are usually found in a Yas build). It just makes it so the more you try and buy protections against Yas the more effective his boosts become. Now this argument does stretch into other problems LoL in general has but it brings up the main reason I dislike him in general; there is almost no way to counter build a Yas since the more you buy things that **are** supposed to counter him, the higher the amount of gold you spent is made worthless.

You buy more armor and more armor is made useless, the more health you buy the higher damage you receive.
